verses.verse: Now <S%H4994><s%> will I sing <S%H7891><s%> to my well beloved <S%H3039><s%> a song <S%H7892><s%> of my beloved <S%H1730><s%> touching his vineyard. <S%H3754><s%> My well beloved <S%H3039><s%> has a vineyard <S%H3754><s%> in a very fruitful <S%H1121><s%> <S%H8081><s%> hill: <S%H7161><s%>

And he fenced <S%H5823><s%> it, and gathered out the stones <S%H5619><s%> thereof, and planted <S%H5193><s%> it with the choicest <S%H8321><s%> vine, <S%H8321><s%> and built <S%H1129><s%> a tower <S%H4026><s%> in the middle <S%H8432><s%> of it, and also <S%H1571><s%> made <S%H2672><s%> a wine press <S%H3342><s%> therein: <S%H8432><s%> and he looked <S%H6960><s%> that it should bring <S%H6213><s%> forth <S%H6213><s%> grapes, <S%H6025><s%> and it brought <S%H6213><s%> forth <S%H6213><s%> wild <S%H891><s%> grapes. <S%H891><s%>

And now, <S%H6258><s%> O inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> and men <S%H376><s%> of Judah, <S%H3063><s%> judge, <S%H8199><s%> I pray <S%H4994><s%> you, between <S%H996><s%> me and my vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>

What <S%H4100><s%> could have been done <S%H6213><s%> more <S%H5750><s%> to my vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> that I have not done <S%H6213><s%> in it? why, <S%H4069><s%> when I looked <S%H6960><s%> that it should bring <S%H6213><s%> forth <S%H6213><s%> grapes, <S%H6025><s%> brought <S%H6213><s%> it forth <S%H6213><s%> wild <S%H891><s%> grapes? <S%H891><s%>

And now <S%H6258><s%> go to; I will tell <S%H3045><s%> you what <S%H853><s%> <S%H834><s%> I will do <S%H6213><s%> to my vineyard: <S%H3754><s%> I will take <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> the hedge <S%H4881><s%> thereof, and it shall be eaten <S%H398><s%> up; and break <S%H6555><s%> down the wall <S%H1447><s%> thereof, and it shall be trodden <S%H4823><s%> down:

And I will lay it waste: <S%H1326><s%> it shall not be pruned, <S%H2168><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> dig; <S%H5737><s%> but there shall come <S%H5927><s%> up briers <S%H8068><s%> and thorns: <S%H7898><s%> I will also command <S%H6680><s%> the clouds <S%H5645><s%> that they rain <S%H4305><s%> no rain <S%H4306><s%> on it.

For the vineyard <S%H3754><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> is the house <S%H1004><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> and the men <S%H376><s%> of Judah <S%H3063><s%> his pleasant <S%H8191><s%> plant: <S%H5194><s%> and he looked <S%H6960><s%> for judgment, <S%H4941><s%> but behold <S%H2009><s%> oppression; <S%H4939><s%> for righteousness, <S%H6666><s%> but behold <S%H2009><s%> a cry. <S%H6818><s%>

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to them that join <S%H5060><s%> house <S%H1004><s%> to house, <S%H1004><s%> that lay <S%H7126><s%> field <S%H7704><s%> to field, <S%H7704><s%> till <S%H5704><s%> there be no <S%H657><s%> place, <S%H4725><s%> that they may be placed <S%H3427><s%> alone <S%H905><s%> in the middle <S%H7130><s%> of the earth! <S%H776><s%>

In my ears <S%H241><s%> said the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> Of a truth <S%H518><s%> <S%H3808><s%> many <S%H7227><s%> houses <S%H1004><s%> shall be desolate, <S%H8047><s%> even great <S%H1419><s%> and fair, <S%H2896><s%> without <S%H369><s%> inhabitant. <S%H3427><s%>

Yes, <S%H3588><s%> ten <S%H6235><s%> acres <S%H6776><s%> of vineyard <S%H3754><s%> shall yield <S%H6213><s%> one <S%H259><s%> bath, <S%H1324><s%> and the seed <S%H2233><s%> of an homer <S%H2563><s%> shall yield <S%H6213><s%> an ephah. <S%H374><s%>

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to them that rise <S%H7925><s%> up early <S%H7925><s%> in the morning, <S%H1242><s%> that they may follow <S%H7291><s%> strong drink; <S%H7941><s%> that continue <S%H309><s%> until night, <S%H5399><s%> till wine <S%H3196><s%> inflame <S%H1814><s%> them!

And the harp, <S%H3658><s%> and the viol, <S%H5035><s%> the tabret, <S%H8596><s%> and pipe, <S%H2485><s%> and wine, <S%H3196><s%> are in their feasts: <S%H4960><s%> but they regard <S%H5027><s%> not the work <S%H6467><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> consider <S%H7200><s%> the operation <S%H4639><s%> of his hands. <S%H3027><s%>

Therefore <S%H3651><s%> my people <S%H5971><s%> are gone into captivity, <S%H1540><s%> because they have no <S%H1097><s%> knowledge: <S%H1847><s%> and their honorable <S%H3519><s%> men <S%H4962><s%> are famished, <S%H7458><s%> and their multitude <S%H1995><s%> dried <S%H6704><s%> up with thirst. <S%H6772><s%>

Therefore <S%H3651><s%> hell <S%H7585><s%> has enlarged <S%H7337><s%> herself, <S%H5315><s%> and opened <S%H6473><s%> her mouth <S%H6310><s%> without <S%H1097><s%> measure: <S%H2706><s%> and their glory, <S%H1926><s%> and their multitude, <S%H1995><s%> and their pomp, <S%H7588><s%> and he that rejoices, <S%H5938><s%> shall descend <S%H3381><s%> into it.

And the mean <S%H120><s%> man <S%H120><s%> shall be brought <S%H7817><s%> down, <S%H7817><s%> and the mighty <S%H376><s%> man <S%H376><s%> shall be humbled, <S%H8213><s%> and the eyes <S%H5869><s%> of the lofty <S%H1364><s%> shall be humbled: <S%H8213><s%>

But the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> shall be exalted <S%H1361><s%> in judgment, <S%H4941><s%> and God <S%H410><s%> that is holy <S%H6918><s%> shall be sanctified <S%H6942><s%> in righteousness. <S%H6666><s%>

Then shall the lambs <S%H3532><s%> feed <S%H7462><s%> after their manner, <S%H1699><s%> and the waste <S%H2723><s%> places of the fat <S%H4220><s%> ones shall strangers <S%H1481><s%> eat. <S%H398><s%>

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to them that draw <S%H4900><s%> iniquity <S%H5771><s%> with cords <S%H2256><s%> of vanity, <S%H7723><s%> and sin <S%H2402><s%> as it were with a cart <S%H5699><s%> rope: <S%H5688><s%>

That say, <S%H559><s%> Let him make speed, <S%H4116><s%> and hasten <S%H2363><s%> his work, <S%H4639><s%> that we may see <S%H7200><s%> it: and let the counsel <S%H6098><s%> of the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One of Israel <S%H3478><s%> draw near <S%H7126><s%> and come, <S%H935><s%> that we may know <S%H3045><s%> it!

Woe <S%H1945><s%> to them that call <S%H559><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> good, <S%H2896><s%> and good <S%H2896><s%> evil; <S%H7451><s%> that put <S%H7760><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> for light, <S%H216><s%> and light <S%H216><s%> for darkness; <S%H2822><s%> that put <S%H7760><s%> bitter <S%H4751><s%> for sweet, <S%H4966><s%> and sweet <S%H4966><s%> for bitter! <S%H4751><s%>
Woe <S%H1945><s%> to them that are wise <S%H2450><s%> in their own eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and prudent <S%H995><s%> in their own sight! <S%H6440><s%>
Woe <S%H1945><s%> to them that are mighty <S%H1368><s%> to drink <S%H8354><s%> wine, <S%H3196><s%> and men <S%H582><s%> of strength <S%H2428><s%> to mingle <S%H4537><s%> strong drink: <S%H7941><s%>
Which justify <S%H6663><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> for reward, <S%H7810><s%> and take <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> the righteousness <S%H6666><s%> of the righteous <S%H6662><s%> from him!

Therefore <S%H3651><s%> as the fire <S%H784><s%> devours <S%H398><s%> the stubble, <S%H7179><s%> and the flame <S%H3852><s%> consumes <S%H7503><s%> the chaff, <S%H2842><s%> so their root <S%H8328><s%> shall be as rottenness, <S%H4716><s%> and their blossom <S%H6525><s%> shall go <S%H5927><s%> up as dust: <S%H80><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> they have cast <S%H3988><s%> away the law <S%H8451><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> and despised <S%H5006><s%> the word <S%H565><s%> of the Holy <S%H6918><s%> One of Israel. <S%H3478><s%>

Therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> is the anger <S%H639><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> kindled <S%H2734><s%> against his people, <S%H5971><s%> and he has stretched <S%H5186><s%> forth his hand <S%H3027><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> them, and has smitten <S%H5221><s%> them: and the hills <S%H2022><s%> did tremble, <S%H7264><s%> and their carcasses <S%H5038><s%> were torn <S%H5478><s%> in the middle <S%H7130><s%> of the streets. <S%H2351><s%> For all <S%H3605><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> his anger <S%H639><s%> is not turned <S%H7725><s%> away, but his hand <S%H3027><s%> is stretched <S%H5186><s%> out still. <S%H5750><s%>

And he will lift <S%H5375><s%> up an ensign <S%H5251><s%> to the nations <S%H1471><s%> from far, <S%H7350><s%> and will hiss <S%H8319><s%> to them from the end <S%H7097><s%> of the earth: <S%H776><s%> and, behold, <S%H2009><s%> they shall come <S%H935><s%> with speed <S%H4120><s%> swiftly: <S%H7031><s%>

None <S%H369><s%> shall be weary <S%H5889><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> stumble <S%H3782><s%> among them; none <S%H3808><s%> shall slumber <S%H5123><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> sleep; <S%H3463><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall the girdle <S%H232><s%> of their loins <S%H2504><s%> be loosed, <S%H6605><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> the lace <S%H8288><s%> of their shoes <S%H5275><s%> be broken: <S%H5423><s%>

Whose <S%H834><s%> arrows <S%H2671><s%> are sharp, <S%H8150><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> their bows <S%H7198><s%> bent, <S%H1869><s%> their horses' <S%H5483><s%> hoofs <S%H6541><s%> shall be counted <S%H2803><s%> like flint, <S%H6864><s%> and their wheels <S%H1534><s%> like a whirlwind: <S%H5492><s%>

Their roaring <S%H7581><s%> shall be like a lion, <S%H3833><s%> they shall roar <S%H7580><s%> like young <S%H3715><s%> lions: <S%H3715><s%> yes, they shall roar, <S%H5098><s%> and lay hold <S%H270><s%> of the prey, <S%H2964><s%> and shall carry <S%H6403><s%> it away safe, <S%H6403><s%> and none <S%H369><s%> shall deliver <S%H5337><s%> it.

And in that day <S%H3117><s%> they shall roar <S%H5098><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> them like the roaring <S%H5100><s%> of the sea: <S%H3220><s%> and if one look <S%H5027><s%> to the land, <S%H776><s%> behold <S%H2009><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> and sorrow, <S%H6862><s%> and the light <S%H216><s%> is darkened <S%H2821><s%> in the heavens <S%H6183><s%> thereof.
